title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, and requiring preauthorization for length of stay determination. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates group health plans to cover inpatient stays determined by a physician, prohibits eligibility denial based on coverage requirements, penalizes providers for non-compliance, offers incentives to reduce stays, and requires preauthorization for stay length. Appeals process and penalties are established, along with notice requirements for compliance. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Act is amended to include sections 2704 and 2706. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. SEC. 713. STANDARDS FOR HOSPITAL LENGTHS OF STAY. Group health plans and health insurance issuers must provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. They are prohibited from denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following these guidelines, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for length of stay determinations. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of this section, including incentives to reduce inpatient stays and preauthorization requirements for length of stay determinations. The imposition of these requirements will be treated as a material modification in the terms of the plan for notice purposes. The text discusses amendments to certain sections of the Act related to providing summary descriptions and conforming clerical changes. "Amendment to the Public Health Service Act includes a new section on standards for hospital lengths of stay under individual health insurance." The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market. A health insurance issuer must comply with notice requirements under ERISA. Amendments apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999. Group market reforms apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999, with a special rule for collective bargaining agreements. Amendments do not apply to plan years before the termination of collective bargaining agreements or January 1, 1999. The amendments made by subsection (b) apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market starting on January 1, 1999. Section 104(1) of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 is amended to coordinate regulations with other relevant laws.
